data.title: Harold Wilson's Cold War: the Labour government and East-West politics, 1964-1970
data.text:
TY - BOOK

T1 - Harold Wilson's Cold War

T2 - the Labour government and East-West politics, 1964-1970

AU - Hughes, Geraint

N1 - Includes bibliographical references (p. 179-196) and index

PY - 2009

Y1 - 2009

N2 - "Harold Wilson's Cold War analyses the Labour government's efforts to promote East-West detente and to improve Anglo-Soviet relations from 1964 to 1970." "Geraint Hughes challenges the caricature of Harold Wilson's rigid subservience to America, and shows how, as Prime Minister, he proposed to develop closer contacts with the Soviet leadership, and to foster co-operation on arms control, conflict resolution in Vietnam, and East-West trade."--BOOK JACKET

AB - "Harold Wilson's Cold War analyses the Labour government's efforts to promote East-West detente and to improve Anglo-Soviet relations from 1964 to 1970." "Geraint Hughes challenges the caricature of Harold Wilson's rigid subservience to America, and shows how, as Prime Minister, he proposed to develop closer contacts with the Soviet leadership, and to foster co-operation on arms control, conflict resolution in Vietnam, and East-West trade."--BOOK JACKET

KW - Kalter Krieg

KW - Labour Party

KW - Aussenpolitik

M3 - Book

SN - 9780861932986

SN - 0861932986

BT - Harold Wilson's Cold War

PB - The Boydell Press

CY - Woodbridge, Suffolk
